componenttext: Okay. And then if I have a chance to ask another question -- and again, I apologize if this has already been asked. I just wanted some more clarification on some of the changes in legislatures that are going on in Peru with respect to water. And what impact that would have on Yanacocha, i.e., how do we need to get the mine prepared for these new legislature and sort of costing on this and implications?

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 29, 2015
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Tanya. We haven't covered that yet, but good question. It's one that we actually have been working for a number of years with the government as they've brought forward new regulations, and then been working with them on modifying them. They actual
componenttext: Thanks, Tanya. We haven't covered that yet, but good question. It's one that we actually have been working for a number of years with the government as they've brought forward new regulations, and then been working with them on modifying them. They actually rolled out some regulations that exceed by almost 1,000 times what requirements are in most other countries around the world, so trying to get the regulations back to something that's actually physically achievable on the ground. We've been making an investment in a water treatment plant there since earlier this year that is scheduled to be completed early next year. That will put us on track to meet what we would expect to be the final regulations though we're still working through that process with the government.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 29, 2015

componenttext: Okay. And has it been very cordial in terms of exceeding 1,000 times the required regulations in other jurisdictions, are they pretty amenable to acknowledging that this might be not achievable?

componenttext: Yes. No, Gary, I'd probably just echo what you said that we're still confident that we can achieve those sort of improvements in the mine as we work through it. And I think, as you said, it's early days. Our mine planning folks and technical folks continue to look at it, but we're optimistic that we can do that. I think the other piece of it is, while we talk about the mill, the New Valley leach is going very well. Our team is very confident that we can bring that in on time or a bit ahead of schedule and comfortable with cost there. So while we focus a bit on the mill, the heart of the operation is the Valley leach, and that's going very well, early stage with our folks coming on and taking that over.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 29, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes. We can lay out more details as we run through our guidance for next year. But in general, what we did for Phase 6, we got nonrecourse bank financing that was put in place in rough terms. We're looking at a total cost for the stripping campaign of aro
componenttext: Yes. We can lay out more details as we run through our guidance for next year. But in general, what we did for Phase 6, we got nonrecourse bank financing that was put in place in rough terms. We're looking at a total cost for the stripping campaign of around $2 billion. And the financing that we currently would see required to be in the $700 million to $800 million range. But that's just sort of a rough ballpark.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 29, 2015
componenttextpreview: Thanks, again, for joining our third quarter earnings call this morning. Our team continues to drive stronger performance across the portfolio and the sector, and we're not resting on our laurels. Our goal is to continue improving safety and efficiency at
componenttext: Thanks, again, for joining our third quarter earnings call this morning. Our team continues to drive stronger performance across the portfolio and the sector, and we're not resting on our laurels. Our goal is to continue improving safety and efficiency at our operations and to continue building a longer-life, lower-cost portfolio. Ultimately, we're working to create the value we need to fund profitable growth, pay down debt, and most importantly, generate cash for our shareholders. Thanks, again, and have a safe day.

headline: Newmont Mining Corporation, Q3 2015 Earnings Call, Oct 29, 2015

componenttext: Thank you. And that concludes today's conference. Thank you all for participating. You may now disconnect.
